arts.ttl: Cunha stars as Wolves put FOUR past Fulham
arts.sum: Matheus Cunha scored two goals and assisted one as Wolverhampton Wanderers stunned Fulham with a 4-1 victory at Craven Cottage, making it back-to-back Premier League wins. The Nigeria international is one of six Fulham players to start all 12 Premier League games in 2024/25, with Silva now confident in his ability to produce a rounded performance on a constant basis.

arts.ttl: Wolves 4-1 Fulham (23 de Nov., 2024) Resultado Final

Fulham reaction. The post Fulham defeat ‘difficult to take’ – Silva appeared first on West London Sport.

arts.ttl: Wolves thrash Fulham: Gary O'Neil waxes lyrical over "incredible" display at Craven Cottage
arts.sum: Wolverhampton Wanderers head coach Gary O'Neil heaps praise on his players after a rejigged starting lineup guides the club to a 4-1 victory at Fulham in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Gary O’Neil hails ‘limitless’ Matheus Cunha as Wolves fight back for Fulham win
arts.sum: The Brazil forward made it six goals for the season after his 31st-minute finish helped Wolves draw level after Alex Iwobi’s opener from distance.
Wolverhampton Wanderers head coach Gary O'Neil says he wants his players to enjoy their "incredible" 4-1 win over Fulham in the Premier League.

arts.ttl: Matheus Cunha double lifts Wolves out of bottom three in win at Fulham
arts.sum: When so many have doubted him, Gary O’Neil fights on. And on. While Wolves have Matheus Cunha to hand and in such form there will be hope of redemption. The Brazilian, with two fine finishes and an adept assist, made it two wins in succession, catching Fulham cold before killing them off with a spectacular strike as they pushed for a late equaliser. After breaking their winless duck by beating Southampton, and surviving the international break that can be so deadly for managers, O’Neil’s employment prospects, bleak for much of the season, take a turn for the positive. Victory at Fulham was a coup. Wolves had soundly beaten a club in a position their owners aspire to. Continue reading...

arts.ttl: Cunha stars as Wolves run riot at Fulham to move out of drop zone
arts.sum: Matheus Cunha scored twice to help Wolves come from behind to win 4-1 at Fulham as Gary O'Neil's side moved out of the Premier League relegation zone.

arts.ttl: Fulham 1-3 Wolverhampton Wanderers: Highlights, man of the match, stats as Matheus Cunha stars in Premier League clash
arts.sum: Sports Mole looks at the highlights, man of the match, and stats from Saturday's Premier League clash between Fulham and Wolverhampton Wanderers.

arts.ttl: Matheus Cunha bags brace as Wolves strike back to earn first away win at Fulham
arts.sum: Cunha’s strike after 31 minutes cancelled out Alex Iwobi’s opener, before the Wolves forward set up Joao Gomes after the break.
